attributes.action: UK referendum on EU if Juncker gets Commission Job
attributes.additional_details:
For the UK to hold a referrendum at the same time as the 2015 General Election if Jean-Claude Juncker becomes head of the EU Commission on its continued membership of the European Union.

For the result of the referendum to be binding on whatever party wins the next election as all three main parties have given voice that they do not support Jean-Claude Juncker to become the next head of the EU Commission.

That there the government bans EU interferrence with the referrendum and that media, polical and others with a financial conflict of interes must disclose such when if communicating their point of view in a public domain or if otherwise for public consumption.
